posts.post_content: The whole [sanguine bond](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=sanguine bond) combo sounds really nice, I can see this card becoming a great counter for decks dedicated to building up the life of their users ([reverence wall](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=reverence wall) centric and the like). Otherwise, the card is a bit too slow as stated by Designer\_Genes. Artwork is awesome as hell too. I'll give it a 4/5 because I see great potential if someone figures out a way to cast it without paying full mana cost.

posts.post_content:
Ok, the problem of this thing is CMC=6; in a more closer look the kicker cost is also a little odd unless your playing limited/block.  
I, personally, don't really care about it been expensive, if you guys think of it, you may let your opponent gain life like a whale for the first 6 turns and then "WOW MAN! here my combo kills you no matter your life total"; you can easily run this in a non/low-creatures deck.  
A must have in my Garza Zol deck.

Posted By: WER386 (12/26/2009 8:00:11 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Sanguine bond is worth it, if you're playing vampires. Lifelink, Corrupt-like effects, and straight-up gain aplenty. So if you've included a bond, you might as well run this. Not as a four-of, mind you. And it's too slow of a combo to turn it into a combo deck (well, unless you're not playing Standard, where you could find some black mana accelerant), but it's worth an inclusion for the potential 2-card win.
posts.html:
Sanguine bond is worth it, if you're playing vampires. Lifelink, Corrupt-like effects, and straight-up gain aplenty. So if you've included a bond, you might as well run this. Not as a four-of, mind you. I like to play multi player alot...
